EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS

IRM 21.5.1, Account Resolution-General Adjustments, dated August 27, 2021 (effective October 1, 2021) is superseded. This IRM also includes the following IRM Procedural Updates (IPUs): IPU 21U0872 issued 07-22- 2021, IPU 21U1142 issued 10-04-2021, IPU 21U1319 issued 12-07-2021, IPU 22U0221 issued 02-04-2022, IPU 22U0366 issued 03-10-2022, IPU 22U0472 issued 04-05-2022, IPU 22U0530 issued 04-22-2022 and IPU 22U0726 issued 06-15-2022.
AUDIENCE

All IRS organizations - Small Business/Self Employed (SB/SE), Large Business & International (LB&I), Tax Exempt and Government Entities (TE/GE) and Wage and Investment (W&I), Appeals, Employee Plans (all employees performing account work).
Karen Michaels

) Purpose: This IRM provides the general adjustment procedures using Inte- grated Data Retrieval System (IDRS) to all Master File Tax Codes (MFTs) Scope and for account adjustments not covered in any other Internal Revenue Manual (IRM). (
) Audience: All IRS employees in Business Operating Divisions (BODs) who adjust taxpayers accounts by telephone, correspondence, or in person. (
) Policy Owner: The Director of Accounts Management is the policy owner of this IRM. (
) Program Owner: Policy and Procedures (PPI) is the program owner of this IRM. (

) Primary Stakeholders: The primary stakeholders are organizations that Accounts Management collaborates with; for example, Return Integrity & pliance Services (RICS), Compliance and Submission Processing. (

) Program Goals: Program goals for this type of work are: • Achieve a high customer accuracy rate for phone calls and paper ad- justments • Efficiency in resolving general adjustment cases • Continuous assessment for program vulnerabilities and opportunities improvement • Effective communication with customers The Accounts Management Program Letter provides additional information

) OVERRIDE CODE - An Override Code is required when the IRS Received Date is over one year old and on cases when the statute has expired. a. R - Using override code “R” allows you to use an IRS Received Date (IRS-RCVD-DT) that is older than a year. b. S - Using override code “S” allows you to use the current date and the Refund Statute Control Date (RFSCD) that is later than the Refund Statue Expiration Date (RSED). For example, when a claim is received timely before the RSED has expired, but the adjustment is being input ″ after the RSED has expired, use override code S.” Refer to IRM

returns, any refund claims (tax decreases or credit increases) after April

as the RFSCD.
